name: Kempinski Hotel River Park Bratislava

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Brand new hotel, not my type of building.....too big and shiny.
reviews.title: One of the best city 5 star hotel

reviews.text: Room was nice but not very big. Anyway, everything is new so looks pretty good.
reviews.title: Very satisfied with Kempinski Bratislava

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was not impressed till I reached the spa area on the top floor. Amazing, the best spa area I have seen maybe. We spent most of our time there, just relaxing and enjoying the great view.
reviews.title: Five star accommodation, five star service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was really nice, specially the ones at the spa.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: Food was good and the restaurant is a nice area.
reviews.title: 5 stars comfort

reviews.text: Fantastic hotel, luxury at it's finest. The complementary use of the rolls is a nice touch. I read other reviews of people complaining about have to wait for the car, we used it 3-4 times and never waited longer than 5-10 mins. Food in restaurant was good and very reasonably priced, be careful of the zlaty bazant beer, after 4or5 I happened to notice it was 12%!! :-) PS the spa is very relaxing and luxurious with a drinks round the pool service, however prepare to be open minded(or blinded) to use the "adult" steam room etc
reviews.title: The place to stay!

reviews.text: Stayed there for business, I was very positively surprised about the quality of this hotel and hotel service. Just the Rolls Royce was not available, so I was offered BMW. Interestingly enough, Rolls is for free while for BMW you have to pay. Hotel is not directly in city center but pretty near - Bratislava is very small so almost everything is in walking distance. To Kempinski you need to take taxi but, obviously, this type of hotel requires travelling in style! Moreover, taxi is generally very cheap in Bratislava.
reviews.title: Highest comfort possible

reviews.text: Spa is excellent, I really enjoyed it. Breakfast is also great experience.
reviews.title: Good but far from city centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with some colleagues for business trip. Rooms are really nice, bath room very surprising. Very hard matrasses though.
reviews.title: One of the best city hotels in the world

reviews.text: We had dinner in the hotel restaurant, but this is very expensive and quality does not match expectations at this price level.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel with great staff

reviews.text: Having arrived in Bratislava after a stay at the Four Seasons Gresham Palace in Budapest, the bar was set quite high and this property measured up in virtually all respects.
reviews.title: A Very Compelling Reason to Enjoy Bratislava

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the quality of the rooms is outstanding at the price point and the design team is to be commended for creating a business hotel that also exudes a sense of glamour and sensuality that most similar properties lack. The baths are quite large, with lots of glass and modern digital controls.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel. Best in middle Europe

reviews.text: Second, the complimentary Zion Spa and gym is well-executed and feature-laden. The pool, locker rooms, and wet areas are truly outstanding and absolutely immaculate, creating the perfect place to while away a few moments or most of the day.
reviews.title: Quite out of this world - Best hotel I have stayed in

reviews.text: Third, the hotel excels at services and amenities, with most being complimentary. The Rolls Royce, which is complimentary for one trip a day, obviously is the stand-out, but one also has tea on arrival, coffee delivered with the wake-up call, and the business center computers all at no additional charge, and those services are often preciously priced when available.
reviews.title: The best hotel in the WORLD!

reviews.text: Fourth, I found the service to be extremely attentive, informed, and always helpful, especially in helping me plan my outings. The hotel is a short distance from Bratislava Castle and Old Town, yet the walk is pleasant in decent weather and there are other easy options ranging from the Rolls to taxis to buses and trams which stop quite close to the hotel.
reviews.title: Courteous and extremely help staff

reviews.text: We have just returned from a a 3 night stay and cannot praise this hotel highly enough. I am a travel agent, and this is truly a 5 star experience, with lovely staff who work very hard to deliver. Nothing is too much trouble, and whilst being 5 star there is no feeling of being over the top. Thank you to every one, the breakfast are amazing, the rooms beatifully designed and the pool is reallly fantastic. WIsh we were there right now. The Rolls Royce is also a lovely feature. We honestly could not find one thing wrong!
reviews.title: Beautiful 5 star Hotel - Wonderful

reviews.text: I have the pleasure of being able to stay here on business whilst working in Bratislava, although it's a few minutes walk from the town centre in comparison to the Crowne Plaza, they are two very different hotels. The rooms are generous, very nicely decorated and the bathroom very stylish.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, with great customer service

reviews.text: The service is unlike any other 5 star hotel I've stayed in, the morning wake up call comes with a tray of complimentary tea or coffee which is such a nice touch when you're away from home. However as a female the biggest benefit has to be the spa... the gym is large and the outlook is across the danube, the pool is lovely at 15m means you can actually swim in it, but if that's too much the sauna, steam room, two whirlpools, ice showers etc...are perfect if you need some relaxation. For the ultimate relaxation book yourself a massage, even the massage beds are amazing.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: Food in the restaurant is good as is room service and the breakfast offer gives a large range of everything you could wish for.
reviews.title: Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The complimentary car to five destinations is also a unique selling point, and I have been in the rolls royce which makes you feel very special.
reviews.title: Wow factor hotel

description: Bratislava`s latest luxury hotel and lifestyle hot spot, located uniquely on the banks of the River Danube and close to the Imperial City Center. Enjoy the city`s only rooftop indoor pool, and an outstanding ZION SPA offering extensive treatments. For discerning traveller, the hotel offers 231 rooms & suites, Executive Club floor,butler service for Executive Club rooms and all suites, 11 fully equipped meeting rooms with Danube view, the fashionable ARTE Restaurant, the extraordinary River Bank Brasserie, the vivid Park Lounge, the cozy Churchill Cigar Club, and exclusive Executive Club Lounge.
